id.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the ID for the resource.

name.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the Name for the resource.

description.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the description for the resource.

items.description:
A JSONPath expression to use to extract individual items from the resource,
items are extracted first and then the ID,Name,Type and transformations are applied for each item.

type.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the type for the resource.

class.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the class for the resource.

format.description: Format of config item, defaults to JSON, available options are JSON, properties

status.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the status of the config item

health.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the health of the config item

timestampFormat.description:
TimestampFormat is a Go time format string used to
parse timestamps in createFields and DeletedFields.
If not specified, the default is RFC3339.

createFields.description:
CreateFields is a list of JSONPath expression used to identify the created time of the config.
If multiple fields are specified, the first non-empty value will be used.

deleteFields.description:
DeleteFields is a JSONPath expression used to identify the deleted time of the config.
If multiple fields are specified, the first non-empty value will be used.

tags.description:
Tags for each config item.
Max allowed: 5

properties.description:
Properties are custom templatable properties for the scraped config items
grouped by the config type.

connection.description: ConnectionName of the connection. It'll be used to populate the endpoint, accessKey and secretKey.

skipTLSVerify.description: Skip TLS verify when connecting to aws

skipTLSVerify.description: Skip TLS verify when connecting to aws

createFields.description:

tags.description:
Tags for each config item.
Max allowed: 5

properties.description:
Properties are custom templatable properties for the scraped config items
grouped by the config type.

activityLogs.description:
ActivityLogs is a list of operations to exclude from activity logs.
Example:
 "Microsoft.ContainerService/managedClusters/listClusterAdminCredential/action"
 "Microsoft.ContainerService/managedClusters/listClusterUserCredential/action"

BigQueryConfig.description: BigQueryConfig contains configuration for BigQuery log scraping

details.description:
Details of the change in json format.
Defaults to the text.

timeFormat.description:
TimeFormat is the go time format for the `createdAt` field.
Defaults to RFC3339.

filter.description: Filter selects what change to apply the mapping to

severity.description: Severity is the severity to be set on the change

type.description: Type is the type to be set on the change

action.description:
Action allows performing actions on the corresponding config item
based on this change. Example: You can map EC2 instance's "TerminateInstances"
change event to delete the corresponding EC2 instance config.
	Allowed actions: "delete", "ignore"

summary.description: Summary replaces the existing change summary.

config_id.description:
ConfigID is a CEL expression that returns the target config's external ID
for redirecting changes to a different config item.

config_type.description: ConfigType is the target config type for redirecting changes.

scraper_id.description: ScraperID is the scraper ID for the target config. Use "all" for cross-scraper lookups.

types.description:
Optionally specify the config types
from which the JSONPath fields need to be removed.
If left empty, all config types are considered.

ConfigFieldExclusion defines fields with JSONPath that needs to
be removed from the config.

include.description:
Include is a list of GCP asset types to scrape.
Reference: https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/supported-asset-types
Example: storage.googleapis.com/Bucket

exclude.description: Exclude is a list of GCP asset types to exclude from scraping.

auditLogs.description: AuditLogs query the BigQuery dataset for audit logs.

dataset.description:
BigQuery dataset to query audit logs from
Example: "default._AllLogs"

since.description:
Time range to query audit logs (defaults to last 7 days if not specified)
Examples: "24h", "7d", "30d"

userAgents.description: Filter user agents matching these patterns

principalEmails.description: Filter principal emails matching these patterns

serviceNames.description: Filter service names matching these patterns

GCPCloudLoggingConfig.description: GCPCloudLoggingConfig contains configuration for GCP Cloud Logging

status.description:
Returns workflow runs with the check run status or conclusion that you specify.
For example, a conclusion can be success or a status can be in_progress.

grouped by the config type.

connection.description: ConnectionName, if provided, will be used to populate personalAccessToken

actor.description:
Returns someone's workflow runs.
Use the login for the user who created the push associated with the check suite or workflow run.

branch.description: Returns workflow runs associated with a branch. Use the name of the branch of the push.

GitHubActions.description:
GitHubActions scraper scrapes the workflow and its runs based on the given filter.
By default, it fetches the last 7 days of workflow runs (Configurable via property: scrapers.githubactions.maxAge)

watch.description:
Watch specifies which Kubernetes resources should be watched.
This allows for near real-time updates of the config items
without having to wait for the scraper on the specified interval.

event.description: Event specifies how the Kubernetes event should be handled.

exclusions.description: Exclusions excludes certain kubernetes objects from being scraped.

relationships.description: Relationships specify the fields to use to relate Kubernetes objects.

exclusions.description: Exclusions defines what events needs to be dropped.

namespace.description: Namespace defines which field to use for the namespace lookup

type.description:
Types on which this plugin should run.
Supports match expression
Example: AWS::*, Kubernetes::Namespace

filter.description:
A Cel expression, when provided, must return true for this filter to apply.

Receives the config item as the cel env variable.

withParent.description: The type of the parent to be used

loki.description: Loki specifies the Loki configuration for log scraping

gcpCloudLogging.description: GCPCloudLogging specifies the GCP Cloud Logging configuration

openSearch.description: OpenSearch specifies the OpenSearch configuration for log scraping

bigQuery.description: BigQuery specifies the BigQuery configuration for log scraping

fieldMapping.description: FieldMapping defines how source log fields map to canonical LogLine fields

LokiConfig.description: LokiConfig contains configuration for Loki log scraping

selector.description: Selector is a CEL expression that selects on what config items to apply the mask.

jsonpath.description: JSONPath specifies what field in the config needs to be masked

value.description: Value can be a hash function name or just a string

OpenSearchConfig.description: OpenSearchConfig contains configuration for OpenSearch log scraping

nextPageExpr.description:
CEL expression to extract next page URL or request from response.
Receives response map with body, headers, status, url fields.
Returns string (URL), map (request spec with url/method/body/headers), or null (stop).

reduceExpr.description:
CEL expression to merge pages using accumulator pattern.
Receives acc ([]any, starts empty) and page (response body). Returns new acc.

perPage.description: Process each page independently instead of merging.

maxPages.description: Maximum number of pages to fetch. 0 means unlimited.

ScrapeConfig.description: ScrapeConfig is the Schema for the scrapeconfigs API

crdSync.description:
CRDSync when set to true, will create (or update) the corresponding database record
for a config item of the following types
- MissionControl::Playbook, MissionControl::ScrapeConfig, MissionControl::Canary

full.description: Full flag when set will try to extract out changes from the scraped config.

ScraperSpec.description: ScraperSpec defines the desired state of Config scraper

SeverityKeywords.description:
SeverityKeywords is used to identify the severity
from the Kubernetes Event reason.

grouped by the config type.

since.description:
Fetch the messages since this period.
Default: 7d

Specify the duration string.
  eg: 1h, 7d, ...

channels.description:
Process messages from these channels and discard others.
If empty, all channels are matched.

rules.description: Rules define the change extraction rules.

regexp.description:
Regexp to capture the fields from the text.
Captured fields are available in the templates.

mapping.description: Mapping defines the Change to be extracted from the text.

config.description: Config is a list of selectors to attach the change to.

filter.description: Only those messages matching this filter will be processed.

A JSONPath expression to use to extract individual items from the resource,
items are extracted first and then the ID,Name,Type and transformations are applied for each item.

type.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the type for the resource.

class.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the class for the resource.

format.description: Format of config item, defaults to JSON, available options are JSON, properties

status.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the status of the config item

health.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the health of the config item

timestampFormat.description:
TimestampFormat is a Go time format string used to
parse timestamps in createFields and DeletedFields.
If not specified, the default is RFC3339.

createFields.description:
CreateFields is a list of JSONPath expression used to identify the created time of the config.
If multiple fields are specified, the first non-empty value will be used.

deleteFields.description:
DeleteFields is a JSONPath expression used to identify the deleted time of the config.
If multiple fields are specified, the first non-empty value will be used.

tags.description:
Tags for each config item.
Max allowed: 5

properties.description:
Properties are custom templatable properties for the scraped config items
grouped by the config type.

exclude.description:
Fields to remove from the config, useful for removing sensitive data and fields
that change often without a material impact i.e. Last Scraped Time

mask.description:
Masks consist of configurations to replace sensitive fields
with hash functions or static string.

relationship.description: Relationship allows you to form relationships between config items using selectors.

mapping.description: Mapping is a list of CEL expressions that maps a change to the specified type

exclude.description: Exclude is a list of CEL expressions that excludes a given change

id.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the ID for the resource.

name.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the Name for the resource.

description.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the description for the resource.

items.description:
A JSONPath expression to use to extract individual items from the resource,
items are extracted first and then the ID,Name,Type and transformations are applied for each item.

type.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the type for the resource.

class.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the class for the resource.

format.description: Format of config item, defaults to JSON, available options are JSON, properties

status.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the status of the config item

health.description: A static value or JSONPath expression to use as the health of the config item

timestampFormat.description:
TimestampFormat is a Go time format string used to
parse timestamps in createFields and DeletedFields.
If not specified, the default is RFC3339.

createFields.description:
CreateFields is a list of JSONPath expression used to identify the created time of the config.
If multiple fields are specified, the first non-empty value will be used.

deleteFields.description:
DeleteFields is a JSONPath expression used to identify the deleted time of the config.
If multiple fields are specified, the first non-empty value will be used.

tags.description:
Tags for each config item.
Max allowed: 5

properties.description:
Properties are custom templatable properties for the scraped config items
grouped by the config type.

TrivyK8sOptions.description: TrivyK8sOptions holds in Trivy flags that are Kubernetes specific.
